title: of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Enterprise, Trade and Employment
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Enterprise, Trade and Employment 

(Delegation of Ministerial Functions) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited enterprise trade employment (delegation ministerial functions) order 2023

title: of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of
heading: 2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of
text_raw:
2. The powers (other than the power to prosecute an offence) and duties of 

the Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment conferred on him – 

(a) 

by or under the enactments specified in Part 1 of the Schedule, 
and 

(b) under the Regulations specified in Part 2 of the Schedule, 

are delegated to Neale Richmond, Minister of State at the Department of 
Enterprise, Trade and Employment. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 27th January, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [14] 3
text_norm: 2 power (other power prosecute offence) duty minister enterprise trade employment conferred - (a) enactment specified part 1 schedule (b) regulation specified part 2 schedule delegated neale richmond minister state department enterprise trade employment notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 27th january 2023 14 3

title: of the Ministers and Secretaries (Amendment) (No. 2) Act 1977 (No. 28 of
heading: Patents Act 1992 (No. 1 of 1992)
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

PART 1 

Patents Act 1992 (No. 1 of 1992) 

Trade Marks Act 1996 (No. 6 of 1996) 

Copyright and Related Rights Act 2000 (No. 28 of 2000) 

Industrial Designs Act 2001 (No. 39 of 2001) 

Knowledge Development Box (Certification of Inventions) Act 2017 (No. 6 of 
2017) 

Metrology Acts 1980 to 1996 

National Standards Authority of Ireland Act 1996 (No. 28 of 1996) 

Minimum Notice and Terms of Employment Acts 1973 to 2005 

Protection of Employment Acts 1977 to 2014 

Payment of Wages Act 1991 (No. 25 of 1991) 

Terms of Employment (Information) Acts 1994 to 2014 

Organisation of Working Time Act 1997 (No. 20 of 1997) 

National Minimum Wage Acts 2000 and 2015 

Protection of Employees (Part-Time Work) Act 2001 (No. 45 of 2001) 

Protection of Employees (Fixed-Term Work) Act 2003 (No. 29 of 2003) 

Protection of Employees (Temporary Agency Work) Act 2012 (No. 13 of 
2012) 

Safety in Industry Acts 1955 to 1987 

Dangerous Substances Acts 1972 and 1979 

Safety, Health and Welfare (Offshore Installations) Acts 1987 and 1995 

Chemical Weapons Act 1997 (No. 28 of 1997) 

Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road Act 1998 (No. 43 of 1998) 

Safety, Health and Welfare at Work Acts 2005 to 2014 

Chemicals Acts 2008 and 2010 

Trade Union Acts 1871 to 1990 

Workplace Relations Act 2015 

Industrial Relations Acts 1946 to 2019 

Construction Contracts Act 2013 (No. 34 of 2013) 

Protection of Young Persons (Employment) Act 1996 (No. 16 of 1996) 

Employment Agency Act 1971 (No. 27 of 1971) 

Transnational Information and Consultation of Employees Act 1996 (No. 276 
of 1996) 

 
 
 4 [14] 

Worker Participation (State Enterprises) Acts 1977 to 2001 

Unfair Dismissals Acts 1977 to 2015 

Employment Permits Acts 2003 to 2020 

Redundancy Payments Acts 1967 to 2022 

Protection of Employees (Employers’ Insolvency) Acts 1984 to 2020 

Payment of Wages (Amendment) (Tips and Gratuities) Act 2022 (No. 23 of 
2022) 

Sick Leave Act 2022 (No. 24 of 2022) 

 
 
 
 [14] 5 

PART 2 

Legal Metrology 
Instruments) Regulations 2018 (S.I. No. 2 of 2018) 

(European Conformity Assessment of Measuring 

European Union (Non-Automatic Weighing Instruments) Regulations 2018 
(S.I. No. 47 of 2018) 

European Union (Equipment and Protective Systems Intended for Use in 
Potentially 

Explosive Atmospheres) Regulations 2017 and 2022 

European Union (Lifts and Safety Components for Lifts) Regulations 2017 and 
2022 

European Union (Pressure Equipment) Regulations 2017 and 2022 

European Communities (Carriage of Dangerous Goods by Road and Use of 
Transportable 

Pressure Equipment) Regulations 2011 to 2021 

European Communities (Machinery) Regulations 2008 to 2015 

European Union (Personal Protective Equipment) Regulations 2018 and 2022 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of Government, 

24 January, 2023. 

LEO VARADKAR, 

Taoiseach. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [14]
